intro: Hesperochiron lasianthus, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and showy blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Hesperochiron lasianthus is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
